text: Found this hidden gem tucked just outside Paya Lebar Square, serving up authentic Japanese ramen and gyoza. Tried all three of their soup bases: 1) the tonkotsu was rich, creamy, and deeply satisfying, 2) the miso was salty, umami-packed, and incredibly comforting, and 3) the shoyu had a light sweetness with bold soy flavor‚Äîclean and refreshing. The gyoza were crisp on the outside, juicy on the inside, and bursting with savory goodness. Portions are generous, noodles cooked to al dente perfection, and each bowl comes with huge, tender slices of pork. Bonus points for the free flow of hard-boiled eggs and crunchy bean sprouts. A solid spot for a hearty, satisfying meal that hits all the right notes. The only downside? Expect a short wait during peak hours‚Äîbut it‚Äôs well worth it.

Keisuke Tonkotsu King remains our top spot for a quick and satisfying ramen fix. The prices are reasonable and comes with complimentary free flow bean sprouts (for that daily veggie intake) and hard boiled eggs. The soup base is made richer and more intense by the Japanese owner to cater for local taste. It‚Äôs definitely one of our favorite ramen, that surpass even some of the popular ramens in Japan. With over 10 outlets across the island now, there is no longer a need to queue.

Ramen Keisuke Tonkotsu King Niku King at Paya Lebar offers exceptional ramen with rich, flavorful broth and generous portions of tender chashu. The complimentary hard-boiled eggs and bean sprouts add a unique touch. The cozy ambiance, adorned with Japanese decor, enhances the dining experience. Service is efficient, though there may be waiting times during busy hours. A must-visit for ramen lovers! üçúüëëüëçüèªüåü

The restaurant has a traditional Japanese feel to it, pretty nice. Nice tasting ramen with flavorful tonkatsu broth. Have the selection for different taste like less salty, noodle hardness, oil level... And the rare salmon katsu is so good, must try. Overall a nice eating experience.

The ramen never disappoints. Cooked to your liking - normal, soft or hard.

Ajitama (Ramen egg) was nicely done.

They offer unlimited hard boiled eggs as well as bean sprouts so you can top up your ramen with these freebies.
